metadata.titleEn: Indian Ocean Tropical cyclone best track and satellite-based precipitation and convection datasets（1978-2019；2000-2019）
metadata.titleCn: 印度洋热带气旋及降雨对流个例样本特征数据集（1978-2019；2000-2019）
metadata.description:
The accuracy of tropical cyclone (tropical storm) track forecasting improved by nearly 50% for lead times of 24–72 h since 1990s. Over the same period forecasting of tropical cyclone intensity showed only limited improvement. Given the limited prediction skill of models of tropical cyclone intensity based on environmental properties, there have been a wealth of studies of the role of internal dynamical processes of tropical cyclones, which are largely linked to precipitation properties and convective processes. The release of latent heat by convection in the inner core of a tropical cyclone is considered crucial to tropical cyclone intensification. 16-year satellite-based precipitation, and clouds top infrared brightness temperature were used to explore the relationship between precipitation, convective cloud, and tropical cyclone intensity change.  The 6-hourly TC centers were linearly interpolated to give the hourly and half hourly tropical cyclone center positions, to match the temporal resolution of the precipitation and clouds top infrared brightness temperature.
More precipitation is found as storms intensify, while tropical cyclone 24 h future intensity change is closely connected with very deep convective clouds with IR BT < 208 K. Intensifying tropical cyclones follow the occurrence of colder clouds with IR BT < 208 K with greater areal extents. As an indicator of very deep convective clouds, IR BT < 208 K is suggested to be a good predictor of tropical cyclone intensity change（Ruan&Wu，2018，GRL）. The properties of the satellite-based precipitation, and clouds top infrared brightness temperature are therefore suggested to be important measurements to study tropical cyclone intensity, intensity change and their underlying mechanisms. The high resolution of the satellite-based precipitation (3h), and cloud top infrared brightness temperature (half hour) datasets also makes them possible to be used to study tropical cyclone variability associated with diurnal cycle.
metadata.descriptionCn:
在过去几十年中，相对于热带气旋(在印度洋称为热带风暴)的路径预报，热带气旋强度的预报能力提高非常有限。 降雨的潜热释放通常认为驱动热带气旋增强非常重要的过程。 很多研究表明热带气旋的降雨和对流特征是影响热带气旋强度变化的非常重要过程，而环境变量相对来说对强度预报的作用非常有限。基于此，提取和热带气旋最佳路径数据500公里范围内匹配的卫星观测降雨和对流(云顶亮温)数据，来研究这些变量和热带气旋强度和强度变化的关系。
首先将不同来源资料进行时空匹配，包括对原始的热带气旋最佳路径数据与卫星降水和对流数据进行了时空匹配，包括位置对应，时间和空间分辨率的匹配，同时采用线性插值将路径中心位置插值到每小时；热带气旋对应的降雨数据基于TRMM卫星观测计算，热带气旋对应的云顶亮温数据基于多源定轨红外卫星计算，然后根据最佳路径空间位置、时间和影响半径（距气旋中心500km），动态提取和计算相关范围内的TRMM卫星降水和多源定轨红外卫星的红外亮温数据，得到台风路径3小时分辨率的降水和对流数据，其中降水空间分辨率0.25°，对流空间分辨率4km。
该数据显示降雨和热带气旋的强度有非常好的线性关系，降雨越大的热带气旋对应的热带气旋的强度越强。但是这不能说明热带气旋增强是由降雨引起的，快速增强的热带气旋和快速减弱的热带气旋对应的降雨都可以很强。热带气旋从快速减弱到快速增强，深对流云（云顶亮温<208 K）的强度和面积都逐步增大，而与热带气旋的强度没有线性的对应关系。这一部分深对流云的变化领先于热带气旋强度24小时变化, 因此可以作为判断热带气旋强度变化非常重要的指标（Ruan and Wu，2018，GRL）。与热带气旋相对应的降雨和对流特征，可以很好的用来研究热带气旋强度以及强度变化。同时，该数据的降雨具有3小时的分辨率，云顶温度具有半小时的分辨率， 可以做日变化尺度上的相关研究。
metadata.instructions:
The data is in NC format, and each tropical cyclone is a file. The tropical cyclones in each year are listed in order of occurrence, such as 2001_ 2. NC is the data related to the second tropical cyclone in the ocean basin in 2001. Each document includes the basic information of tropical cyclone, such as longitude and latitude, time, maximum sustained wind speed and name of tropical cyclone, spatial distribution of infrared cloud top brightness temperature and rainfall within 500km of tropical cyclone center, as well as longitude and latitude distribution of corresponding space.
In order to match the satellite data, the location of the track center is interpolated to every hour. The rainfall data corresponding to tropical cyclones is calculated based on TRMM satellite observation and cloud top brightness temperature data corresponding to tropical cyclones are calculated based on multi-source orbit determination infrared satellite.
It is divided into two folders according to the North Indian Ocean and the South Indian Ocean. Each variable is described in the following table.
                                                             Time resolution   Description
lat   Latitude of tropical cyclone center     per hour       Best path raw data time resolution is 6h, which is 0, 6, 12 and 18 h (UTC) respectively, and is linearly interpolated to every hour
lon  Longitude of tropical cyclone center  per hour      The same as above
vmax maximum sustained wind speed      per hour      The same as above
time  Tropical cyclone time                        per hour      Best path time resolution is 6h, which is 0,6,12,18h (UTC) Julian day
data00 Infrared brightness temperature    per hour      The spatial distribution within 500km of the tropical cyclone center at  the hour (UTC) 
data30 Infrared brightness temperature    per hour      The spatial distribution within 500km of the tropical cyclone center at  the half hour (UTC) 
lonm_bt The longitude distribution of infrared brightness temperature  per hour  The corresponding longitude distribution of data00 and data30 
latm_bt The Latitudinal distribution of infrared brightness temperature  per hour  The corresponding latitude distribution of data00 and data30
precip  Precipitation                              every 3 hours      Spatial distribution of precipitation within 500km of tropical cyclone center
lonm_pre   Longitude distribution of precipitation every 3 hours  Longitude distribution of precip 
latm_pre    Latitude distribution of precipitation every 3 hours  Latitude distribution of precip 
name   tropical cyclone name
metadata.instructionsCn:
数据为4个NC格式文件，2个印度洋热带气旋及其相关降水对流数据（2000-2019），另2个是热带气旋最佳路径（best track）数据（1978-2019）。具体介绍如下：
TC-north Indian and precipitation, convection和TC-south Indian and precipitation, convection：分别是北印度洋和南印度洋热带气旋特征数据及其周围500km内降水和对流数据。时间范围：2000-2019年。每个热带气旋为一个文件，每一年中的热带气旋按照发生顺序依次标序，如2001_2.nc即为该洋盆中2001年发生的第2个热带气旋相关数据。每个文件包括了热带气旋的经纬度、时间、最大持续风速以及名称等热带气旋的基本信息，热带气旋中心500km内的红外云顶亮温、降雨的空间分布，以及对应空间的经纬度分布。降水空间分辨率0.25°，对流空间分辨率4km。
north indian_1978_2019.nc：北印度洋热带气旋best track数据，从1978年开始；south indian_1977_2019.nc：南印度洋热带气旋best track 数据，从1977开始。这两个数据时间分辨率1小时，无相关降水和对流数据。
北印度洋和南印度洋热带气旋和降水对流数据（TC-north Indian and precipitation, convection和TC-south Indian and precipitation, convection）各变量具体描述如下表格。
　	　	                                              时间精度	描述
lat	           热带气旋中心纬度                 每小时	最佳路径原始数据时间精度为6h，分别为0、6、12、18h（UTC），线性插值至每小时
lon	           热带气旋中心经度	         每小时	同上
vmax                 最大持续风速	                 每小时	同上
time	                  热带气旋时间	         每小时	最佳路径数据时间精度为6h，分别为0、6、12、18h（UTC）Julian Day
data00	                 红外亮温                 每小时	每时刻（UTC）整点时，热带气旋中心500km内的红外亮温空间分布
data30	                 红外亮温	         每小时	每时刻（UTC）半点时，热带气旋中心500km内的红外亮温空间分布
lonm_bt  红外亮温的经度分布	         每小时	data00与data30对应的经度分布
latm_bt   红外亮温的纬度分布        	每小时	data00与data30对应的纬度分布

background: The accuracy of tropical cyclone (TC) track forecasting improved by nearly 50% for lead times of 24–72 h between 1990 and 2008; over the same period forecasting of TC intensity showed only limited improvement. Although it is well known that TC intensification occurs more readily under conditions of higher sea surface temperature, lower vertical wind shear, and higher low troposphere moisture, and these environments are critically important to the prediction of TC intensity change in general and more specifically rapid intensification (RI), studies have shown that these environmental conditions alone are not sufficient to explain changes in TC intensity. Given the limited prediction skill of models of TC intensity based on environmental properties, there have been a wealth of studies of the role of internal dynamical processes of TCs, which are largely linked to precipitation properties and convective processes. The release of latent heat by convection in the inner core of a TC is considered crucial to TC intensification. Through analysis of an 11 year Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) precipitation data set, Jiang (2012) found that extremely intense convection in the inner core increases the possibility of RI, but the difference is not substantial. Using the same data set, Jiang and Ramirez (2013) found that rapidly intensifying TCs are associated with a large area of rainfall with heavy rain in the inner core. By compositing 22 year passive microwave satellite overpasses, Harnos and Nesbitt (2011) detected a convective ring forming 6 h before the onset of RI. Using a 14 year TRMM precipitation radar (PR) data set, Tao and Jiang (2015) found that RI is more likely to be caused by shallow-moderate precipitation, while moderate to very deep convection observed during an RI is more likely to be a response. With two more years of TRMM PR data, Tao et al. (2017) claimed that RI follows significant increases in the occurrence and coverage of stratiform rain, thus stressing the importance of this type of rainfall. In a comparison with TCs with slow intensification rates, Alvey et al. (2015) used 15 year multisatellite passive microwave data to show that storms with higher intensification rates have more symmetric distributions and a larger overall coverage of precipitation prior to the onset of intensification. Satellite-based statistical studies can be used to draw more robust conclusions through analysis of more data sets. However, consensus on the importance of different properties of convection on TC intensity change, especially RI, has not yet been reached despite the extensive use of satellite data by the authors of these cited works. The extent to which convection is a precursor, or simply a reflection of other processes occurring during RI, is also unclear. Studying the diurnal variations in TC convective cloud systems for the period 2000–2013, Wu and Ruan (2016) found that clouds with IR BT< 208 K have a maximum coverage in the morning, and clouds with 208 K< IR BT < 240 K have a maximum coverage in the afternoon. An IR BT of 208 K was chosen as a threshold to identify very deep convection within IR data. Clouds with IR BT < 208 K and 208 K< IR BT < 240 K are termed “very cold deep convective clouds” and “cold high clouds,” respectively, influenced by different diurnal cycles. Different diurnal cycles and different underlying physical mechanisms associated with these two types of TC clouds suggest that they might play different roles in TC intensity change.
research objective: In this paper, satellite-based precipitation, clouds with infrared (IR) brightness temperature (BT), and tropical cyclone (TC) data from 2000 to 2015 are used to explore the relationship between precipitation, convective cloud, and TC intensity change in the Western North Pacific Ocean. In this paper we use 16 year (2000–2015) precipitation data, IR BT data, and TC information to examine the relationships between precipitation, very deep convective clouds, high clouds, and TC intensity changes.
challenges: Although guidance on the intensity of TCs has seen significant improvements, forecasting the intensification of TCs is still a real challenge. Studies have shown that these environmental conditions alone are not sufficient to explain changes in TC intensity. Given the limited prediction skill of models of TC intensity based on environmental properties, there have been a wealth of studies of the role of internal dynamical processes of TCs, which are largely linked to precipitation properties and convective processes. Satellite-based statistical studies can be used to draw more robust conclusions through analysis of more data sets. However, consensus on the importance of different properties of convection on TC intensity change, especially RI, has not yet been reached despite the extensive use of satellite data by the authors of these cited works. The extent to which convection is a precursor, or simply a reflection of other processes occurring during RI, is also unclear.
methods: Best track data were provided by the United States Navy Joint Typhoon Warning Center. The 6-hourly records of the position of the TC center, the intensity of the TC, and other important parameters were included in the best-track data, typically at 0000, 0600, 1200, and 1800 UTC. The 6-hourly TC centers were linearly interpolated to give the 3-hourly and hourly TC center positions, to match the temporal resolution of the precipitation and IR BT data, respectively. A total of 437 storms in the western North Pacific were analyzed for the period 2000–2015. The precipitation data used in this paper are rates of rainfall from the NASA TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA). The TMPA operational product used in this paper is 3B42 (version 7) and has a horizontal resolution of 0.25° × 0.25° between 50°N and 50°S, with a temporal resolution of 3 h. Half-hourly global merged IR BT data were obtained from the United States National Centers for Environmental Prediction Climate Prediction Center. The IR BT data have a pixel size of 4 km by 4 km between 60°N and 60°S. The half-hourly IR BT data were averaged to hourly data to fill gaps in the data. All precipitation and IR BT images were evaluated in terms of TC intensity (maximum sustained wind) and 24 h future intensity changes. All satellite images must show the best-track position 300 km or more away from land to remove any influence from it. The wind fields were obtained from the 0.75° resolution European Centre for Medium Range Weather Forecasts interim reanalysis data set. In this paper, each image is evaluated using wind shear relative coordinates, with wind shear defined as the difference between 850 and 200 hPa winds averaged at a radius of 200–800 km from the TC center. The 6-hourly wind shear data were linearly interpolated to give hourly data to match the temporal resolution of IR BT data.
dataset: The 6-hourly records of the position of the TC center, the intensity of the TC, and other important parameters were included in the best-track data, typically at 0000, 0600, 1200, and 1800 UTC. A total of 437 storms in the western North Pacific were analyzed for the period 2000–2015. The precipitation data used in this paper are rates of rainfall from the NASA TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA). The TMPA operational product used in this paper is 3B42 (version 7) and has a horizontal resolution of 0.25° × 0.25° between 50°N and 50°S, with a temporal resolution of 3 h. Half-hourly global merged IR BT data were obtained from the United States National Centers for Environmental Prediction Climate Prediction Center. The IR BT data have a pixel size of 4 km by 4 km between 60°N and 60°S.
findings: More precipitation and colder clouds with 208 K< IR BT< 240 K are found as storms intensify, while TC 24 h future intensity change is closely connected with very deep convective clouds with IR BT< 208 K. Intensifying TCs follow the occurrence of colder clouds with IR BT< 208 K with greater areal extents. As an indicator of very deep convective clouds, IR BT< 208 K is suggested to be a good predictor of TC intensity change. Based upon the 16 year analysis in the western North Pacific, TCs under the conditions that the mean temperature of very deep convective clouds is less than 201 K, and the coverage of this type of clouds is more than 27.4% within a radius of 300 km of the TC center, will more likely undergo rapid intensification after 24 h.
backgroundCn: 热带气旋（TC）轨迹预测的准确性在1990年至2008年间提高了近50%，而在同一时期，TC强度的预测仅有有限的改善。虽然众所周知，TC增强更容易发生在海表温度较高、垂直风切变较低和低层大气湿度较高的条件下，这些环境条件对TC强度变化的预测至关重要，尤其是快速增强（RI），但研究表明，仅凭这些环境条件并不足以解释TC强度的变化。鉴于基于环境特性的TC强度模型的预测能力有限，许多研究探讨了TC内部动力过程的作用，这些过程主要与降水特性和对流过程相关。TC内核中对流释放的潜热被认为对TC增强至关重要。通过分析11年的热带降水测量任务（TRMM）降水数据集，Jiang（2012）发现，内核中极强的对流增加了RI的可能性，但差异并不显著。使用相同的数据集，Jiang和Ramirez（2013）发现，快速增强的TC与内核中大面积的降雨和强降雨相关。通过对22年的被动微波卫星过境数据进行合成，Harnos和Nesbitt（2011）在RI开始前6小时检测到对流环的形成。使用14年的TRMM降水雷达（PR）数据集，Tao和Jiang（2015）发现，RI更可能是由浅至中等降水引起的，而在RI期间观察到的中等到非常深的对流更可能是对RI的响应。通过增加两年的TRMM PR数据，Tao等（2017）声称，RI跟随平层降雨的发生和覆盖显著增加，从而强调了这种降雨类型的重要性。在与缓慢增强率的TC进行比较时，Alvey等（2015）使用15年的多卫星被动微波数据表明，增强率较高的风暴在增强开始前具有更对称的降水分布和更大的降水覆盖范围。基于卫星的统计研究可以通过分析更多的数据集得出更可靠的结论。然而，尽管这些引用作品的作者广泛使用卫星数据，但关于对流的不同特性对TC强度变化，特别是RI的重要性尚未达成共识。对流在RI过程中是前兆，还是仅仅反映了其他正在发生的过程，仍不清楚。Wu和Ruan（2016）研究了2000年至2013年期间TC对流云系统的日变化，发现红外亮温（IR BT）< 208 K的云在早晨达到最大覆盖，而208 K < IR BT < 240 K的云在下午达到最大覆盖。208 K的IR BT被选为识别红外数据中非常深对流的阈值。IR BT < 208 K和208 K < IR BT < 240 K的云分别被称为“非常冷的深对流云”和“冷高云”，受不同的日变化影响。这两种类型的TC云的不同日变化和不同的物理机制表明，它们可能在TC强度变化中发挥不同的作用。
research objectiveCn: 在本文中，使用2000年至2015年的卫星降水、红外（IR）亮温（BT）云和热带气旋（TC）数据，探讨西北太平洋地区降水、对流云和热带气旋强度变化之间的关系。我们使用16年的（2000–2015年）降水数据、IR BT数据和TC信息，研究降水、非常深的对流云、高云与TC强度变化之间的关系。
challengesCn: 尽管对热带气旋（TC）强度的指导已经有了显著改善，但预测热带气旋的增强仍然是一个真正的挑战。研究表明，仅仅依靠环境条件不足以解释热带气旋强度的变化。由于基于环境特性的热带气旋强度模型的预测能力有限，因此有大量研究关注热带气旋的内部动力过程，这些过程主要与降水特性和对流过程相关。基于卫星的统计研究可以通过分析更多数据集来得出更可靠的结论。然而，尽管这些引用作品的作者广泛使用卫星数据，但关于对流的不同特性对热带气旋强度变化，特别是快速增强（RI）的重要性，尚未达成共识。对流在快速增强过程中是前兆，还是仅仅反映了其他正在发生的过程，这一点也不清楚。
methodsCn: 最佳轨迹数据由美国海军联合台风警报中心提供。最佳轨迹数据包含了热带气旋（TC）中心的位置、强度及其他重要参数的6小时记录，通常在协调世界时（UTC）0000、0600、1200和1800时提供。为了与降水和红外亮温（IR BT）数据的时间分辨率相匹配，6小时的TC中心位置进行了线性插值，以获得3小时和1小时的TC中心位置。对2000年至2015年期间西北太平洋的437个风暴进行了分析。本文使用的降水数据来自NASA的TRMM多卫星降水分析（TMPA）。本文使用的TMPA操作产品是3B42（版本7），其水平分辨率为0.25° × 0.25°，覆盖50°N至50°S，时间分辨率为3小时。半小时全球合并的IR BT数据来自美国国家气象局气候预测中心。IR BT数据的像素大小为4 km × 4 km，覆盖60°N至60°S。半小时的IR BT数据被平均为每小时数据，以填补数据中的空白。所有降水和IR BT图像均根据TC强度（最大持续风速）和未来24小时强度变化进行评估。所有卫星图像必须显示距离陆地300公里或更远的最佳轨迹位置，以消除陆地的影响。风场数据来自0.75°分辨率的欧洲中期天气预报中心临时再分析数据集。本文中，每幅图像均使用相对坐标系下的风切变进行评估，风切变定义为在TC中心半径200-800公里范围内，850 hPa和200 hPa风速的差异。6小时的风切变数据进行了线性插值，以获得每小时数据，以匹配IR BT数据的时间分辨率。
datasetCn: 热带气旋（TC）中心的位置、强度和其他重要参数的6小时记录被纳入最佳轨迹数据，通常在协调世界时（UTC）0000、0600、1200和1800时进行记录。对2000年至2015年期间西北太平洋的437个风暴进行了分析。本文使用的降水数据来自NASA的TRMM多卫星降水分析（TMPA）。本文使用的TMPA操作产品是3B42（版本7），其水平分辨率为0.25° × 0.25°，覆盖纬度范围为50°N至50°S，时间分辨率为3小时。半小时全球合并红外亮温（IR BT）数据来自美国国家气候预测中心气候预测中心。IR BT数据的像素大小为4 km × 4 km，覆盖纬度范围为60°N至60°S。
findingsCn: 随着风暴的增强，降水量增加且冷云的红外亮温（IR BT）在208 K到240 K之间，而热带气旋（TC）未来24小时的强度变化与红外亮温低于208 K的非常深的对流云密切相关。增强的热带气旋伴随着红外亮温低于208 K的冷云出现，并且这些冷云的面积更大。红外亮温低于208 K作为非常深的对流云的指标，被建议作为热带气旋强度变化的良好预测因子。基于对西北太平洋16年的分析，当非常深的对流云的平均温度低于201 K，并且这种云在热带气旋中心300公里半径内的覆盖率超过27.4%时，热带气旋在24小时后更可能经历快速增强。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to match satellite observations with tropical cyclone best-track data in terms of time and space resolution?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据收集方法的示例，用于将卫星观测与热带气旋最佳轨迹数据在时间和空间分辨率上进行匹配？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method involved in matching satellite observations with tropical cyclone best-track data includes spatial and temporal matching of original best-track data with satellite-derived precipitation and convective data. This includes matching positions, aligning time and space resolutions, and using linear interpolation to interpolate the track center position to hourly intervals.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及将卫星观测与热带气旋最佳轨迹数据进行匹配，包括将原始最佳轨迹数据与卫星衍生的降水和对流数据进行空间和时间匹配。这包括匹配位置、对齐时间和空间分辨率，以及使用线性插值将轨迹中心位置插值到每小时的间隔。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when using satellite data for analyzing tropical cyclone intensity changes?
Example.QuestionCn: 使用卫星数据分析热带气旋强度变化时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in using satellite data for analyzing tropical cyclone intensity changes is the limited prediction skill of models based on environmental properties alone, which has led to numerous studies on the role of internal dynamical processes linked to precipitation and convective processes. Despite extensive use of satellite data, consensus on the importance of different convection properties on intensity change, especially rapid intensification, remains unclear.
Example.AnswerCn: 使用卫星数据分析热带气旋强度变化的一个挑战是，仅基于环境特性的模型预测能力有限，这导致了许多研究关注与降水和对流过程相关的内部动力学过程的作用。尽管广泛使用卫星数据，但关于不同对流特性对强度变化，特别是快速增强的重要性，仍然缺乏共识。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you illustrate an example of a dataset that provides insights into the relationship between tropical cyclone precipitation and intensity changes?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否举例说明一个数据集，该数据集提供了热带气旋降水量与强度变化之间关系的见解？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that provides insights into the relationship between tropical cyclone precipitation and intensity changes is the TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA), which offers rainfall rates with a horizontal resolution of 0.25° × 0.25° and a temporal resolution of 3 hours. This dataset was used to analyze 437 storms in the western North Pacific from 2000 to 2015, focusing on the connection between precipitation, convective cloud features, and tropical cyclone intensity changes.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个提供热带气旋降水与强度变化关系洞察的数据集是TRMM多卫星降水分析（TMPA），该数据集提供0.25° × 0.25°的水平分辨率和3小时的时间分辨率的降雨率。该数据集用于分析2000年至2015年间西北太平洋的437个风暴，重点关注降水、对流云特征与热带气旋强度变化之间的联系。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the meaning of 'best track data' in the context of tropical cyclone research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在热带气旋研究中，“最佳轨迹数据”的意思是指对热带气旋路径和强度的最准确和可靠的记录。这些数据通常经过分析和修正，以反映气旋的真实发展情况。
Definition.AnswerEn: Best track data refers to the 6-hourly records of the position of the tropical cyclone center, the intensity of the cyclone, and other important parameters. These data are typically provided by sources like the United States Navy Joint Typhoon Warning Center and include information at specific times, such as 0000, 0600, 1200, and 1800 UTC.
Definition.AnswerCn: 最佳轨迹数据是指热带气旋中心位置、气旋强度及其他重要参数的6小时记录。这些数据通常由美国海军联合台风警报中心等来源提供，并包括在特定时间（如0000、0600、1200和1800 UTC）的信息。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'infrared brightness temperature' used in studying tropical cyclones?
Definition.QuestionCn: “红外亮温”在研究热带气旋中的应用。
Definition.AnswerEn: Infrared brightness temperature (IR BT) is used to analyze cloud characteristics in tropical cyclones. It is measured using satellite data with a spatial resolution of 4 km, and helps identify features like very deep convective clouds based on temperature thresholds, such as IR BT < 208 K. This information is crucial for understanding changes in cyclone intensity.
Definition.AnswerCn: 红外亮温（IR BT）用于分析热带气旋中的云特征。它是通过卫星数据测量的，空间分辨率为4公里，有助于根据温度阈值（如IR BT < 208 K）识别非常深的对流云等特征。这些信息对于理解气旋强度的变化至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the role of 'latent heat release' in the context of tropical cyclone intensification?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在热带气旋增强的背景下，“潜热释放”的作用是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Latent heat release by convection in the inner core of a tropical cyclone is considered a crucial process for cyclone intensification. It is linked to the precipitation and convective processes within the cyclone, where the release of latent heat contributes to the strengthening of the cyclone.
Definition.AnswerCn: 热带气旋内核中的对流潜热释放被认为是气旋增强的关键过程。它与气旋内部的降水和对流过程相关，潜热的释放有助于气旋的加强。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for tropical cyclone intensity forecasting in the Western North Pacific compare to those used in the Indian Ocean with respect to temporal resolution and data sources?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 热带气旋强度预报在西北太平洋的数据收集方法与印度洋的数据收集方法在时间分辨率和数据来源方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the Western North Pacific, data collection involves 6-hourly best-track data provided by the United States Navy Joint Typhoon Warning Center, with linear interpolation to achieve a 3-hourly and hourly temporal resolution for precipitation and infrared brightness temperature (IR BT) data. Precipitation data are sourced from the NASA TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis, and IR BT data from the United States National Centers for Environmental Prediction Climate Prediction Center. In contrast, the Indian Ocean data collection uses satellite observations to match best-track data within a 500-km radius, utilizing TRMM satellite for precipitation and multiple orbiting infrared satellites for cloud top brightness temperature, achieving a 3-hour temporal resolution for precipitation and half-hour for cloud top temperatures.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在西北太平洋，数据收集涉及由美国海军联合台风警报中心提供的每6小时最佳轨迹数据，通过线性插值实现降水和红外亮温（IR BT）数据的3小时和1小时时间分辨率。降水数据来源于NASA TRMM多卫星降水分析，红外亮温数据来自美国国家气象局气候预测中心。相比之下，印度洋的数据收集使用卫星观测来匹配500公里半径内的最佳轨迹数据，利用TRMM卫星进行降水观测，多个轨道红外卫星用于云顶亮温观测，实现降水的3小时时间分辨率和云顶温度的半小时时间分辨率。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with using satellite data to predict tropical cyclone intensity changes, and how might researchers address these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用卫星数据预测热带气旋强度变化面临哪些挑战，研究人员可能如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with using satellite data to predict tropical cyclone intensity changes include the limited prediction skill of models based on environmental properties and the difficulty in reaching a consensus on the importance of different convective properties. Researchers can address these challenges by employing satellite-based statistical studies to analyze more data sets, exploring the diurnal variations in convective cloud systems, and refining the understanding of how different types of clouds and precipitation influence cyclone intensity changes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用卫星数据预测热带气旋强度变化所面临的挑战包括基于环境特性的模型预测技能有限，以及在不同对流特性的重要性上难以达成共识。研究人员可以通过采用基于卫星的统计研究来分析更多数据集，探索对流云系统的昼夜变化，并完善对不同类型云和降水如何影响气旋强度变化的理解，从而应对这些挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in improving the prediction skill of tropical cyclone intensity using environmental properties?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响利用环境特性提高热带气旋强度预测技能的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Studies have shown that environmental conditions such as higher sea surface temperature, lower vertical wind shear, and higher low troposphere moisture are important but not sufficient to fully explain changes in tropical cyclone intensity. The limited prediction skill of models based solely on these environmental properties has led to further exploration of internal dynamical processes linked to precipitation properties and convective processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 研究表明，环境条件如较高的海面温度、较低的垂直风切变和较高的低层大气湿度是重要的，但不足以完全解释热带气旋强度的变化。仅仅基于这些环境特性的模型预测能力有限，这促使人们进一步探索与降水特性和对流过程相关的内部动力学过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to reach a consensus on the role of different convective properties on tropical cyclone intensity change?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在热带气旋强度变化中，不同对流特性的作用达成共识是困难的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Despite extensive use of satellite data, there is no clear consensus on how different properties of convection impact tropical cyclone intensity change, especially rapid intensification. The extent to which convection is a precursor or merely a reflection of other processes occurring during rapid intensification remains unclear.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 尽管广泛使用卫星数据，但对于对流的不同特性如何影响热带气旋强度变化，尤其是快速增强，仍没有明确的共识。对流在快速增强过程中是前兆还是仅仅反映了其他正在发生的过程，仍然不清楚。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the difficulty in forecasting the intensification of tropical cyclones despite improvements in guidance on their intensity?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 尽管在热带气旋强度预测方面的指导有所改善，但预测热带气旋增强的困难原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The forecasting of tropical cyclone intensification remains challenging because environmental conditions alone are not sufficient to explain intensity changes. The internal dynamical processes of tropical cyclones, largely linked to precipitation and convective processes, have been studied extensively, yet a clear understanding of their roles and mechanisms is still lacking.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 热带气旋强度变化的预测仍然具有挑战性，因为仅仅依靠环境条件不足以解释强度变化。热带气旋的内部动力过程，主要与降水和对流过程相关，已经得到了广泛研究，但对它们的作用和机制仍然缺乏清晰的理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes can be expected if satellite data is integrated with best track data to enhance the prediction of tropical cyclone intensity changes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 如果将卫星数据与最佳轨迹数据结合起来，以增强热带气旋强度变化的预测，可以预期哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating satellite data with best track data can lead to a better understanding of the relationship between precipitation, convective cloud characteristics, and tropical cyclone intensity changes. This approach helps to identify patterns such as the presence of very deep convective clouds, which can serve as indicators of potential rapid intensification of tropical cyclones.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将卫星数据与最佳轨迹数据相结合，可以更好地理解降水、对流云特征与热带气旋强度变化之间的关系。这种方法有助于识别模式，例如非常深的对流云的存在，这可以作为热带气旋潜在快速增强的指示器。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What results might be observed by using a dynamic extraction method for matching tropical cyclone paths with satellite data within a 500 km radius?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用动态提取方法将热带气旋路径与500公里半径内的卫星数据匹配，可能会观察到哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a dynamic extraction method allows for the accurate assessment of rainfall and cloud characteristics surrounding tropical cyclones. This method can reveal the influence of convective processes on cyclone intensity, indicating that larger areas of heavy rainfall and specific cloud patterns are associated with stronger cyclones and potential rapid intensification.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用动态提取方法可以准确评估热带气旋周围的降雨和云特征。这种方法可以揭示对流过程对气旋强度的影响，表明更大范围的强降雨和特定的云模式与更强的气旋及潜在的快速增强相关。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind integrating satellite-based precipitation and infrared brightness temperature data with tropical cyclone path data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 将卫星降水和红外亮温数据与热带气旋路径数据集成的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The integration aims to explore the relationship between precipitation, convective cloud features, and tropical cyclone intensity changes, with a focus on understanding how these variables interact and contribute to the intensity and rapid intensification of cyclones.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 该集成旨在探讨降水、对流云特征与热带气旋强度变化之间的关系，重点理解这些变量如何相互作用并对气旋的强度和快速增强贡献。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the analysis of deep convective cloud patterns in predicting tropical cyclone intensity changes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 驱动深对流云模式分析以预测热带气旋强度变化的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The analysis of deep convective cloud patterns aims to identify potential predictors for tropical cyclone intensity changes, particularly rapid intensification. By understanding the role and timing of these cloud features, researchers hope to improve forecasting models and provide more reliable predictions of cyclone behavior.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 深对流云模式的分析旨在识别热带气旋强度变化，特别是快速增强的潜在预测因子。通过理解这些云特征的作用和时机，研究人员希望改善预测模型，并提供更可靠的气旋行为预测。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedural steps involved in matching tropical cyclone best track data with satellite precipitation and convective data to study the relationship with cyclone intensity changes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
将热带气旋最佳轨迹数据与卫星降水和对流数据匹配，以研究气旋强度变化之间的关系的程序步骤包括：

1. 收集热带气旋最佳轨迹数据，包括气旋的时间、位置、强度等信息。
2. 收集卫星降水和对流数据，确保数据的时间和空间分辨率与气旋数据相匹配。
3. 对热带气旋最佳轨迹数据进行预处理，确保数据格式一致，并提取相关的时间和空间信息。
4. 对卫星降水和对流数据进行预处理，进行必要的插值或重采样，以匹配气旋的时间和空间分布。
5. 确定匹配的时间窗口，例如在气旋经过的前后几小时或几天内。
6. 将气旋最佳轨迹数据与卫星数据进行空间匹配，提取气旋路径附近的降水和对流信息。
7. 进行统计分析，比较气旋强度变化与降水和对流数据之间的关系。
8. 进行结果可视化，展示气旋强度变化与卫星数据之间的关系。
9. 撰写研究报告，总结研究发现并提出结论。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedure involves spatially and temporally matching the original best track data of tropical cyclones with satellite precipitation and convective data. This includes aligning the positions and matching the temporal and spatial resolutions. Linear interpolation is used to interpolate the track center positions to an hourly basis. Rainfall data is calculated based on TRMM satellite observations, and cloud-top brightness temperature data is derived from multi-source geostationary satellites. Data within a 500 km radius of the cyclone center is dynamically extracted and calculated to obtain 3-hourly resolution precipitation and convective data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程涉及将热带气旋的原始最佳轨迹数据与卫星降水和对流数据在空间和时间上进行匹配。这包括对位置进行对齐，并匹配时间和空间分辨率。使用线性插值将轨迹中心位置插值到每小时一次。降雨数据基于TRMM卫星观测计算，云顶亮温数据则来自多源静止卫星。动态提取并计算气旋中心500公里半径内的数据，以获得3小时分辨率的降水和对流数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological approach is used to ensure the quality and accuracy of the matched data from different sources when studying tropical cyclone intensity and related convective processes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在研究热带气旋强度和相关对流过程时，采用什么方法论方法来确保来自不同来源的匹配数据的质量和准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The approach involves carefully matching data from different sources, such as best track data and satellite observations, ensuring that the temporal and spatial resolutions are compatible. Linear interpolation is applied to align the temporal resolutions of the datasets, and the data matching accounts for position and spatial resolution differences. The matched data is evaluated for quality by ensuring it aligns with known cyclone paths and characteristics, and any discrepancies are addressed through careful data preprocessing and validation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该方法涉及仔细匹配来自不同来源的数据，例如最佳轨迹数据和卫星观测，确保时间和空间分辨率兼容。应用线性插值来对齐数据集的时间分辨率，并且数据匹配考虑了位置和空间分辨率的差异。匹配的数据通过确保其与已知的气旋路径和特征一致来进行质量评估，任何差异都通过仔细的数据预处理和验证进行处理。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What satellite technologies enable the collection of high-resolution precipitation and infrared brightness temperature data for tropical cyclone analysis?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些卫星技术能够收集高分辨率降水和红外亮温数据，以用于热带气旋分析？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of NASA TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA) and multi-source geostationary infrared satellites, such as those providing IR brightness temperature data, enables the collection of high-resolution precipitation and infrared brightness temperature data. These technologies allow for temporal resolutions of 3 hours and half-hourly data that can be averaged to hourly, with spatial resolutions of 0.25° for precipitation and 4 km for infrared data, respectively.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用NASA TRMM多卫星降水分析（TMPA）和多源静止红外卫星（如提供红外亮温数据的卫星），可以收集高分辨率的降水和红外亮温数据。这些技术允许3小时和半小时的数据时间分辨率，可以平均为每小时数据，降水的空间分辨率为0.25°，红外数据的空间分辨率为4公里。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the assessment of diurnal variations in convective cloud systems associated with tropical cyclones?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够评估与热带气旋相关的对流云系统的昼夜变化？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The assessment of diurnal variations in convective cloud systems is enabled by using satellite-based infrared brightness temperature data, which have a high temporal resolution of half-hourly observations. This allows researchers to identify and analyze the diurnal cycles of very cold deep convective clouds and cold high clouds, using thresholds such as an IR BT of 208 K to differentiate between these cloud types. The temporal resolution provides the detail needed to observe changes throughout the day, contributing to the understanding of their roles in tropical cyclone intensity change.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过使用卫星基于红外亮温数据的高时间分辨率（半小时观测），可以评估对流云系统的日变化。这使研究人员能够识别和分析非常寒冷的深对流云和寒冷高云的日循环，使用如208 K的红外亮温阈值来区分这些云类型。时间分辨率提供了观察全天变化所需的细节，有助于理解它们在热带气旋强度变化中的作用。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the prediction models of tropical cyclone intensity based on environmental properties show limited prediction skill, despite improvements in data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管数据收集方法有所改进，但基于环境特性的热带气旋强度预测模型可能显示出有限的预测能力，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Although environmental conditions such as sea surface temperature and wind shear are important, they are not sufficient to explain changes in TC intensity. Internal dynamical processes, linked to precipitation properties and convective processes, play a crucial role that is not fully captured by environmental data alone.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 尽管海表温度和风切变等环境条件很重要，但它们不足以解释热带气旋强度的变化。与降水特性和对流过程相关的内部动力过程发挥着至关重要的作用，而这些过程并未完全被环境数据所捕捉。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the use of satellite-based statistical studies not have reached a consensus on the importance of different convection properties on tropical cyclone intensity change?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么基于卫星的统计研究可能未能就不同对流特性对热带气旋强度变化的重要性达成共识？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The extensive use of satellite data has not led to a consensus because the role of convection as a precursor or a reflection of other processes during rapid intensification remains unclear. Different studies emphasize various aspects such as shallow-moderate precipitation or very deep convection, indicating complexity and variability in these processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 卫星数据的广泛使用并未导致共识，因为对流在快速增强过程中作为前兆或反映其他过程的角色仍然不清楚。不同的研究强调了浅-中等降水或非常深的对流等不同方面，表明这些过程的复杂性和变异性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do certain convective cloud characteristics, such as very deep convection, precede changes in tropical cyclone intensity, and how might this influence data collection strategies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 某些对流云特征，如非常深的对流，为什么会在热带气旋强度变化之前出现，以及这可能如何影响数据收集策略。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Very deep convective clouds with IR BT < 208 K have been shown to precede TC intensity changes, suggesting they are important indicators. This influences data collection strategies by highlighting the need for precise temporal and spatial resolution in capturing convective cloud dynamics to predict intensity changes effectively.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 非常深的对流云，其红外亮温（IR BT）低于208 K，已被证明可以预示热带气旋强度的变化，这表明它们是重要的指标。这影响了数据收集策略，强调了在捕捉对流云动态以有效预测强度变化时，需要精确的时间和空间分辨率。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the main challenges faced when integrating multiple satellite datasets for tropical cyclone research?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在整合多个卫星数据集进行热带气旋研究时，面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple satellite datasets for tropical cyclone research presents challenges such as ensuring spatial and temporal matching of data from different sources, maintaining consistency in resolution and coverage, and dealing with potential data gaps. These challenges must be carefully managed to ensure that the integrated datasets provide an accurate and comprehensive view of the processes influencing tropical cyclone behavior.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 整合多个卫星数据集用于热带气旋研究面临着挑战，例如确保来自不同来源的数据在空间和时间上的匹配，保持分辨率和覆盖范围的一致性，以及处理潜在的数据缺口。这些挑战必须得到妥善管理，以确保整合的数据集能够提供影响热带气旋行为的过程的准确和全面的视图。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your assessment of the potential for expanding these datasets to improve our understanding of rapid intensification of tropical cyclones?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对扩展这些数据集以提高我们对热带气旋快速增强理解的潜力的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: There is significant potential for expanding these datasets to enhance our understanding of rapid intensification of tropical cyclones. By increasing the temporal resolution and incorporating additional variables such as wind shear and sea surface temperature, researchers can gain a more comprehensive view of the factors contributing to rapid intensification. Additionally, the use of newer satellite technologies and increased computational power can lead to more detailed and accurate models.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展这些数据集具有重要潜力，可以增强我们对热带气旋快速增强的理解。通过提高时间分辨率并纳入额外变量，如风切变和海表温度，研究人员可以更全面地了解导致快速增强的因素。此外，利用新型卫星技术和增强的计算能力可以生成更详细和准确的模型。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how data collection methods can address the challenges of predicting tropical cyclone intensity changes effectively.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何有效应对预测热带气旋强度变化的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection methods in this domain often involve the integration of satellite-based precipitation and infrared brightness temperature data with best-track data of tropical cyclones. The challenges in predicting intensity changes are addressed by analyzing the internal dynamical processes of tropical cyclones, which are linked to precipitation properties and convective processes. Satellite-based statistical studies can provide more robust conclusions through the analysis of multiple datasets, though consensus on the importance of different convection properties remains unresolved.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在这个领域的数据收集方法通常涉及将卫星降水和红外亮温数据与热带气旋的最佳轨迹数据相结合。通过分析热带气旋的内部动力过程来解决预测强度变化的挑战，这些过程与降水特性和对流过程相关。基于卫星的统计研究可以通过分析多个数据集提供更可靠的结论，尽管关于不同对流特性的重要性仍然没有达成共识。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the coverage and intensity of convective clouds are evaluated as indicators for tropical cyclone intensity changes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解对流云的覆盖和强度是如何作为热带气旋强度变化的指标进行评估的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The evaluation of convective cloud coverage and intensity as indicators for tropical cyclone intensity changes involves analyzing infrared brightness temperature data. Clouds with IR BT below 208 K are considered very deep convective clouds and are used as predictors of intensity change. The analysis considers both the areal extent and the mean temperature of these clouds within a specified radius of the cyclone center to predict rapid intensification, providing an insight into the role of deep convection in cyclone dynamics.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 对对流云覆盖和强度作为热带气旋强度变化指标的评估涉及分析红外亮温数据。红外亮温低于208 K的云被视为非常深的对流云，并被用作强度变化的预测因子。该分析考虑了这些云在气旋中心指定半径内的面积范围和平均温度，以预测快速增强，从而提供了对深对流在气旋动力学中作用的洞察。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the challenges encountered in forecasting tropical cyclone intensity changes despite advancements in track prediction.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 尽管在轨迹预测方面取得了进展，但在预测热带气旋强度变化时仍面临许多挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Although tropical cyclone track forecasting accuracy improved significantly between 1990 and 2008, the forecasting of intensity showed limited improvement. While environmental factors like sea surface temperature and wind shear are known to be important, they are insufficient to fully explain intensity changes. The complex role of internal dynamical processes, such as precipitation properties and convective processes, remains a challenge. Despite extensive use of satellite data, a consensus on the role of convection in intensity change, especially rapid intensification, has not yet been reached.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 尽管热带气旋路径预测的准确性在1990年至2008年间显著提高，但强度预测的改善有限。虽然海表温度和风切变等环境因素被认为是重要的，但它们不足以完全解释强度变化。内部动力过程的复杂作用，如降水特性和对流过程，仍然是一个挑战。尽管广泛使用卫星数据，但关于对流在强度变化，特别是快速增强中的作用，尚未达成共识。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be used to study the relationship between tropical cyclone intensity changes and convective characteristics.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用来研究热带气旋强度变化与对流特征之间关系的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Datasets such as the NASA TRMM Multisatellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA) and global merged infrared brightness temperature data from the United States National Centers for Environmental Prediction Climate Prediction Center can be used. The TMPA operational product 3B42, version 7, provides rainfall rates with a horizontal resolution of 0.25° × 0.25° and a temporal resolution of 3 hours. Half-hourly infrared brightness temperature data have a pixel size of 4 km by 4 km, averaged to hourly data to study tropical cyclone intensity changes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据集如NASA TRMM多卫星降水分析（TMPA）和美国国家气象局气候预测中心的全球合并红外亮温数据可以被使用。TMPA操作产品3B42，第7版，提供了水平分辨率为0.25° × 0.25°、时间分辨率为3小时的降雨率。半小时红外亮温数据的像素大小为4公里 × 4公里，平均为每小时数据，以研究热带气旋强度变化。
